Shah Alam Spine & orthopaedic specialist is widely recognised in his field to skilfully diagnose & treat your injury or condition so you can emerge stronger and safely return to the activities you enjoy. Prof Dr Md Shah Alam is specialized in advanced spine treatment and a well recognized name in the field of spine & orthopedic surgery in Bangladesh. An extensive experience and updated knowledge of the advancements in the field of spine treatment, make him one of the best spine surgeons in Bangladesh. He is currently working as a consultant at Bangladesh Spine & Orthopedic Hospital, Dhaka and has successfully performed thousands of spine surgeries including most complex cases. Patients across the country & abroad approach him for treatment of degenerative spine disorders, scoliosis treatment, endoscopic discectomy, Slipped disc, cervical spinal disc, Spinal Cord Injury, Back Pain and various other spine related problems. He is a much- appreciated spine and pain specialist who is adept at performing minimally invasive spine surgeries.

doctor.name: Dr. Md. Meraj Uddin Mollah
doctor.workplace: National Institute of Traumatology & Orthopedic Rehabilitation
doctor.info: Dr. Md. Meraj Uddin Mollah completed his MBBS in 2003 from the topmost medical college of Bangladesh (Dhaka Medical College) and later joined the MS Orthopaedic Surgery course at the National Institute of Traumatology and Orthopaedic Rehabilitation (NITOR) formerly known as Pongu Hospital in 2006. He also had brilliant results in HSC and SSC securing 4th and 6th positions respectively in the combined merit list. He completed his MS (Ortho) course in 2010 at the age of 32. He was the youngest Orthopaedic Surgeon while obtaining an MS (Ortho) Degree. He has worked in different capacities in government hospitals in his career under the Ministry of Health (BCS Health). Dr. Md. Meraj Uddin Mollah is an expert in Ilizarov and all kinds of Adult and Paediatric Deformity Correction Surgery. With the technique numerous unsolved Orthopaedic problems can be easily solved, previously thought impossible or very difficult. Numerous limbs have been saved with this surgery which would otherwise require amputation. He is efficiently and successfully treating Orthopaedic patients for the last 15 years and has performed more than 10000 Ilizarov surgeries.

doctor.name: Lt. Col. (Dr.) Md. Zamil Zaidur Rahim
doctor.workplace: Evercare Hospital, Dhaka
doctor.info: Lieutenant Colonel Dr. Md. Zamil Zaidur Rahim graduated (MBBS) from Rajshahi Medical College, one of the top medical colleges in Bangladesh in 1994. He joined the National Institute of Traumatology and Orthopaedic Rehabilitation (NITOR), the highest academic institution in orthopaedics in Bangladesh, in 2005 and completed his M.S. degree in 2009. Dr. Zamil completed the fellowship in arthroscopy and arthroplasty in 2013 from the renowned Apollo Hospital in Delhi, India. Additionally, in 2019, Dr. Zamil received advanced training in Orthopaedics and Ilizarov Surgery from the University of Health Science, Turkey. Before joining Evercare Hospital in Dhaka, he served in Bangladesh Army for 27 years, where he successfully completed more than 3000 arthroscopic, over 200 knee and hip replacements and numerous trauma, orthopaedic and Ilizarov surgeries.

doctor.name: Dr. Arun Kumar Sarker
doctor.workplace: National Institute of Traumatology & Orthopedic Rehabilitation
doctor.info: Dr. Arun Kumar Sarker is a highly skilled orthopedics, trauma, and Ilizarov surgery specialist in Dhaka. He completed his MBBS (Dhaka), BCS (Health), and MS (Orthopedics), and is a Fellow of the American College of Surgeons (FACS, USA). He has also undergone advanced training at the Russian Ilizarov Scientific Centre for Restorative Traumatology & Orthopaedics (RICS, RTO) and completed an Advanced Trauma Course from Tulane University, USA. Dr. Arun specializes in treating bone fractures, joint dislocations, complex trauma, arthritis, osteoarthritis, limb length discrepancies, non-healing fractures, bone infections, and congenital orthopedic deformities. He is especially experienced in the Ilizarov technique for bone lengthening, deformity correction, and complex limb salvage procedures. Dr. Sarker currently serves as an Assistant Professor (Orthopedics/Ilizarov) at the National Institute of Traumatology & Orthopedic Rehabilitation (NITOR). He provides consultations at Medinova Medical Services, Mirpur, situated at Plot # 29-30, Block # Kha, Road # 1, Section # 6, Mirpur 10, Dhaka, with visiting hours from 6.30pm to 8.30pm (Sun, Tue & Thu).
